item.description:
I have noticed that the Dems are better at using Twitter. Not Biden or Schumer (et al) but the Jan 6 Committee is doing it artfully. I think that has been a large part of their success.

#sourcesGoDirect
item.source:markdown:
I have noticed that the Dems are better at using Twitter. Not Biden or Schumer (et al) but the Jan 6 Committee is doing it artfully. I think that has been a large part of their success.
#sourcesGoDirect

item.description:
I bought two tickets for a Mets game on @StubHub.

I assumed I would be able to download and print them, but apparently not.

I don't want to install their app on my phone.

Also I want to send one ticket to my friend, so I don't have to wait for them outside the stadium.

I paid a lot of money for these tickets and after 1/2 hour of screwing with their site, I still don't have anything I can use.
item.source:markdown:
I bought two tickets for a Mets game on @StubHub.
I assumed I would be able to download and print them, but apparently not.
I don't want to install their app on my phone.
Also I want to send one ticket to my friend, so I don't have to wait for them outside the stadium.
I paid a lot of money for these tickets and after 1/2 hour of screwing with their site, I still don't have anything I can use.

item.description:
Which do you watch most?

BTW, since it's my poll I don't get a vote, but I watch HBO Max the most, then Apple TV.

item.description:
I'm going to NYC this week, via Tesla, the first trip to the city since Covid. The plan:

  1. Utopia Bagels in Whitestone to stock up.

  2. Possible excursion to quasi-legal cannabis store.

  3. Hotel in Flushing, early dinner at local Chinese place.

  4. Let's go Mets!! ;-)
item.source:markdown:
I'm going to NYC this week, via Tesla, the first trip to the city since Covid. The plan:
1. Utopia Bagels in Whitestone to stock up.
2. Possible excursion to quasi-legal cannabis store.
3. Hotel in Flushing, early dinner at local Chinese place.
4. Let's go Mets!! ;-)

item.description: Electric Car Cost Per Mile For 277 eCars. https://t.co/oeegTe4nZR
item.source:markdown: Electric Car Cost Per Mile For 277 eCars. https://t.co/oeegTe4nZR

item.description:
Suppose I drive an electric car and I want to drive 100 miles. How much will the electricity cost, approximately?

Same trip for gas-powered cars, how much money would it cost in gallons of gas?

I imagine someone must be keeping track of this in various parts of the country...
item.source:markdown:
Suppose I drive an electric car and I want to drive 100 miles. How much will the electricity cost, approximately?
Same trip for gas-powered cars, how much money would it cost in gallons of gas?
I imagine someone must be keeping track of this in various parts of the country...

item.source:markdown: In other words they were overthrowing the government from the inside, not just in Congress. https://t.co/CcGUtlhiLb

item.description:
@om So many huge silos are only necessary because users don't have an easy place to store their own stuff in the cloud where apps can use the data.

The web is almost a full computer, but it still doesn't have an external disk. I can buy one for my desk, but not in the cloud.
item.source:markdown:
@om So many huge silos are only necessary because users don't have an easy place to store their own stuff in the cloud where apps can use the data.
The web is almost a full computer, but it still doesn't have an external disk. I can buy one for my desk, but not in the cloud.

item.description:
@om Last time I checked Amazon Drive wasn't in any way connected to S3 which is an amazing omission.

Imagine a user-accessible storage system that apps could access. The power is enormous.

No one has done this yet. It has to be done by a company of Amazon's size.

Happy birthday to my very good friend for life, @dsearls.

Keep on truckin! ❤️ https://t.co/HOk8iU09A9
item.source:markdown:
Happy birthday to my very good friend for life, @dsearls.
Keep on truckin! ❤️ https://t.co/HOk8iU09A9
